content.question: Which of the following statements accurately describes the majority opinion of the Supreme Court in United States v. Lopez (1995) ?

choices.label: The necessary and proper clause did not allow Congress to create the Bank of the United States.
Congress may regulate commerce between the states.
State governments can declare federal statutes unconstitutional if they conflict with state law.
Congress may not use the commerce clause to make possession of a gun in a school zone a federal crime.

content.answer: Congress may not use the commerce clause to make possession of a gun in a school zone a federal crime.
